text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-A cold electoral battle is expected in the eastern Bekaa Valley on Sunday in the last round of Lebanon's parliamentary elections.
-The public budget deficit until the end of August reaches 1,990 billion Lebanese pounds.
-Maronite patriarch Sfeir says: "The elections should not make the government forget about people's daily affairs".
-The Lebanese army has arrestd 34 people in south Lebanon for firing into the air to celebrate their supporters' victory in the polls.
-Lebanon's minister of posts and communications Chalaq denies there is a dispute with Sweden's Ericsson.
-Former parliament speaker Husseini will head the coalition ticket in the Bekaa Valley to include candidates of the rival Shi'ite groups Amal and Hizbollah.
-The total number of candidates in Lebanon's five-round general elections are 760 of whom 47 had officially withdrawn, the interior minister says.
